definitions.definition: A man of gentle but not noble birth, particularly a man of means (originally ownership of property) who does not work for a living but has no official status in a peerage; an armiferous man ranking below a knight.
definitions.example: Being a gentleman, Robert was entitled to shove other commoners into the gongpit but he still had to jump out of the way of the knights to avoid the same fate himself.

definitions.definition: Any well-bred, well-mannered, or charming man.

definitions.example: Well, la-di-da, aren't you just a proper gentleman?
Please escort this gentleman to the gentlemen's room.

definitions.definition: (usually historical, sometimes derogatory) An amateur or dabbler in any field, particularly those of independent means.
An amateur player, particularly one whose wealth permits him to forego payment.
